unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter installation program is gaining traction, with significant progress reported in states like Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh. Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) announced on 20/07/2024 that over 2 million smart meters have been deployed under various schemes, aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses for DISCOMs.

unnormalised: The initiative, part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), seeks to replace conventional meters with smart meters to enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption. Experts at IIT Kanpur believe this will empower consumers to manage their energy usage more effectively, potentially leading to lower electricity bills, especially during peak hours like 18:00 hrs.

unnormalised: "This is a crucial step towards modernizing our power distribution infrastructure," stated Shri. Sharma, Secretary, Ministry of Power, during a press briefing earlier today at 11:00 hrs. He further added that the government is committed to achieving 100% smart metering by 31/12/2025, aligning with India's commitment to sustainable development goals. Concerns about data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols, ensuring consumer data remains protected, according to officials at the Central Electricity Authority. The smart meters also support prepaid billing options, giving consumers greater control over their spending.
